info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 7:28PM EDT until July 05 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN DAVIDSON AND CENTRAL RANDOLPH COUNTIES... At 727 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles west of Asheboro to 9 miles east of High Rock Lake, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Asheboro, Lexington, Randleman, North Carolina Zoo, Linwood, Ramseur, Denton, Franklinville, Staley and Gordontown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
